value.title: Huawei worked on facial recognition system to surveil Uighurs, new report claims
value.excerpt: Huawei worked on a facial recognition system to monitor and track China’s Uighur minority, according to a new report from video surveillance researchers at IPVM. First reported by The Washington Post,

value.title: AWS announces SageMaker Clarify to help reduce bias in machine learning models
value.excerpt: As companies rely increasingly on machine learning models to run their businesses, it’s imperative to include anti-bias measures to ensure these models are not making false or misleading assumptions.

value.title: The trouble with AI: Why we need new laws to stop algorithms ruining our lives
value.excerpt: Ethical guidelines are the only tool to date to control AI systems. They're not doing much for our rights, finds a new report.

value.title: Getting started with the Amazon Kendra Google Drive connector
value.excerpt: Amazon Kendra is a highly accurate and easy-to-use intelligent search service powered by machine learning (ML). value.title: Cisco unveils revamped Webex experience, including noise cancellation, AI-powered gesture recognition
value.excerpt: Cisco announced a bevy of new features within its Webex portfolio on Tuesday, as the company ramps up its efforts to compete with rival collaboration players such as Zoom, Slack, Google Meet and Microsoft Teams.

value.title: Study finds that few researchers thoroughly test adversarial attacks on surveillance AI in the real world
value.excerpt: In a new study, researchers find that few adversarial techniques purporting to protect against surveillance AI have been thoroughly tested.

value.title: ViacomCBS Taps AWS as Cloud Provider for Broadcast Operations
value.excerpt: Amazon Web Services and ViacomCBS have announced a strategic partnership that will see AWS become the cloud provider for ViacomCBS’ global broadcast media operations. This deal will see the migration of ViacomCBS’ 425 linear TV channels and 40 global data and media centers to the AWS cloud.

value.title: Can AI help you binge books? BingeBooks is a new service to do … exactly that
value.excerpt: The pandemic has been terrible for many industries, but the book industry has gotten a rare reprieve in an otherwise dismal past decade. Locked in homes and forced to socially distance from others, us humans have more time on our hands and more need to connect to characters than ever before.

value.title: New hybrid architectures are unlocking the power of data and AI (VB Live)
value.excerpt: Learn how upgrading your technology stack can help your business unlock new AI capabilities in this VB Live event.

value.title: Diving into Deep Learning
value.excerpt: It’s deep learning, which represents a step-jump from the previous generations of AI. But what exactly is deep learning? Deep Learning is the popular name for a branch of machine learning techniques called Artificial Neural Networks (neural nets).

value.title: Amazon (AMZN) AWS Teams Up With MGM, Bolsters Cloud Clientele
value.excerpt: Amazon’s AMZN cloud computing arm — Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) — entered a multi-year agreement with Metro Goldwyn Mayer (“MGM”). As part of the latest collaboration, MGM is shifting library and critical SAP workloads to AWS to make advancements in its core media supply chain and enterprise-wide media distribution platform.

value.title: Simon Says AI Tool Turns Text Transcript Into Video-Editing Platform
value.excerpt: Video creators can now use a browser-based text editing program called Simon Says Assemble to assemble rough cuts of video pieces. Simon Says is building on its AI-based transcription tools to enable the text-based video assemblies.

value.title: Microsoft launches Azure Digital Twins in general availability
value.excerpt: Microsoft's Azure Digital Twins service, which launched in preivew in November 2018, is now generally available.

value.title: Google Releases New Coral APIs for IoT AI
value.excerpt: Google has released new APIs and tools for their Coral AI toolkit. The new release brings parity across the C++ and Python SDKs and includes more efficient memory usage. Other updates include additional pre-trained models and general-availability of model pipelining.

value.title: Baidu Apollo gets green light for fully driverless road tests in Beijing
value.excerpt: AutoX announced the roll out a fleet of autonomous RoboTaxis in downtown Shenzhen, representing the first time such vehicles have been deployed in China without safety drivers or remote operators.

value.title: Google Cloud expands edge computing to help companies leverage AI and 5G
value.excerpt: Google Cloud expands its edge computing services by partnering with 200 developers to put their applications closer to enterprise customers.

value.title: Google’s Look to Speak taps gaze-tracking AI to help users with impairments communicate
value.excerpt: Google released an Android app called Look to Speak that enables users to select prewritten phrases to communicate using only their gaze.
